alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 2:32PM CDT until June 09 at 2:05AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC039-149-090715- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0009.000000T0000Z-220609T0705Z/ /CLIO2.1.ER.220608T1320Z.220608T1730Z.220609T0105Z.NO/ 232 PM CDT Wed Jun 8 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Approximately 8 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 4 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Low farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River has crested and is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
